text: The PR3 mixed coxed four competition at the 2018 World Rowing Championships in Plovdiv took place at the Plovdiv Regatta Venue. ==Schedule== The schedule was as follows: {| class="wikitable" ! Date ! Time ! Round |- | Monday 10 September 2018 || 09:30 || Heats |- | Thursday 13 September 2018 || 10:24 || Repechages |- | rowspan=2|Saturday 15 September 2018 || 09:30 || Final B |- | style=background:lemonchiffon| 11:15 ||style=background:lemonchiffon| Final A |} All times are Eastern European Summer Time (UTC+3) ==Results== ===Heats=== Heat winners advanced directly to the A final. The remaining boats were sent to the repechages. ====Heat 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Ellen Buttrick Grace Clough Oliver Stanhope Daniel Brown Erin Wysocki-Jones | align="left"| | 7:09.43 | FA |- | 2 | align="left"|Élodie Lorandi Guylaine Marchand Rémy Taranto Antoine Jesel Robin Le Barreau | align="left"| | 7:18.19 | R |- | 3 | align="left"|Nikki Ayers Alex Vuillermin Ben Gibson James Talbot Renae Domaschenz | align="left"| | 7:28.48 | R |- | 4 | align="left"|Ekaterina Snegireva Olga Kononova Viacheslav Makhov Evgenii Borisov Polina Ruchkina | align="left"| | 7:52.50 | R |- | 5 | align="left"|Kang Hyoun-joo Sun Jin Choi Beom-seo Yu Gyu Sang Cho Youn-hee | align="left"| | 8:04.00 | R |- | 6 | align="left"|Angeles Gutierrez Miguel Nieto Pablo Ramirez Rocio Castro Sofia Palma | align="left"| | 8:30.90 | R |} ====Heat 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Alexandra Reilly Michael Varro Charley Nordin Danielle Hansen Jennifer Sichel | align="left"| | 7:12.84 | FA |- | 2 | align="left"|Kyle Fredrickson Victoria Nolan Bayleigh Hooper Andrew Todd Laura Court | align="left"| | 7:23.08 | R |- | 3 | align="left"|Maksym Zhuk Yelizaveta Korolenko Dmytro Herez Olexandra Yankova Yuliia Malasai | align="left"| | 7:37.69 | R |- | 4 | align="left"|Magdalena Maxelon Daniel Bojarek Robert Niesyczyński Patrycja Kapłon Ewą Obłąk | align="left"| | 8:18.29 | R |- | 5 | align="left"|Subhani Pulukkutti Ajith Palliya Yuresh Kegallage Herath Damayanthi Melvige De Silva | align="left"| | 8:55.69 | R |- | 6 | align="left"|Zohra Mathlouth Hajer Dhaoui Yassine Mersni Mohamed Klaa Olfa Khammessi | align="left"| | 11:19.14 | R |} ===Repechages=== The two fastest boats in each repechage advanced to the A final. The remaining boats were sent to the B final. ====Repechage 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Élodie Lorandi Guylaine Marchand Rémy Taranto Antoine Jesel Robin Le Barreau | align="left"| | 7:28.40 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Olexandra Yankova Yelizaveta Korolenko Dmytro Herez Maksym Zhuk Yuliia Malasai | align="left"| | 7:36.16 | FA |- | 3 | align="left"|Kang Hyoun-joo Sun Jin Choi Beom-seo Yu Gyu Sang Cho Youn-hee | align="left"| | 7:57.72 | FB |- | 4 | align="left"|Magdalena Maxelon Daniel Bojarek Robert Niesyczyński Patrycja Kapłon Ewą Obłąk | align="left"| | 8:13.06 | FB |- | 5 | align="left"|Angeles Gutierrez Miguel Nieto Pablo Ramirez Rocio Castro Sofia Palma | align="left"| | 8:22.48 | FB |} ====Repechage 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Nikki Ayers Alex Vuillermin Ben Gibson James Talbot Renae Domaschenz | align="left"| | 7:20.72 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Kyle Fredrickson Victoria Nolan Bayleigh Hooper Andrew Todd Laura Court | align="left"| | 7:25.55 | FA |- | 3 | align="left"|Ekaterina Snegireva Olga Kononova Viacheslav Makhov Evgenii Borisov Polina Ruchkina | align="left"| | 7:49.16 | FB |- | 4 | align="left"|Subhani Pulukkutti Ajith Palliya Yuresh Kegallage Herath Damayanthi Melvige De Silva | align="left"| | 8:41.22 | FB |- | 5 | align="left"|Zohra Mathlouth Hajer Dhaoui Yassine Mersni Mohamed Klaa Olfa Khammessi | align="left"| | 10:41.26 | FB |} ===Finals=== The A final determined the rankings for places 1 to 6. Additional rankings were determined in the B final. ====Final B==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time |- | 1 | align="left"|Kang Hyoun-joo Sun Jin Choi Beom-seo Yu Gyu Sang Cho Youn-hee | align="left"| | 8:00.08 |- | 2 | align="left"|Magdalena Maxelon Daniel Bojarek Robert Niesyczyński Patrycja Kapłon Ewą Obłąk | align="left"| | 8:10.39 |- | 3 | align="left"|Angeles Gutierrez Miguel Nieto Pablo Ramirez Rocio Castro Sofia Palma | align="left"| | 8:18.27 |- | 4 | align="left"|Subhani Pulukkutti Ajith Palliya Yuresh Kegallage Herath Damayanthi Melvige De Silva | align="left"| | 8:45.31 |- | 5 | align="left"|Zohra Mathlouth Hajer Dhaoui Yassine Mersni Mohamed Klaa Olfa Khammessi | align="left"| | 10:06.17 |- | 6 | align="left"|Ekaterina Snegireva Olga Kononova Viacheslav Makhov Evgenii Borisov Polina Ruchkina | align="left"| | ~~7:47.24~~ |} ====Final A==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time |- | | align="left"|Ellen Buttrick Grace Clough Oliver Stanhope Daniel Brown Erin Wysocki-Jones | align="left"| | 7:00.36 |- | | align="left"|Alexandra Reilly Michael Varro Charley Nordin Danielle Hansen Jennifer Sichel | align="left"| | 7:02.13 |- | | align="left"|Élodie Lorandi Guylaine Marchand Rémy Taranto Antoine Jesel Robin Le Barreau | align="left"| | 7:04.93 |- | 4 | align="left"|Kyle Fredrickson Victoria Nolan Bayleigh Hooper Andrew Todd Laura Court | align="left"| | 7:10.21 |- | 5 | align="left"|Nikki Ayers Alex Vuillermin Ben Gibson James Talbot Renae Domaschenz | align="left"| | 7:13.38 |- | 6 | align="left"|Olexandra Yankova Yelizaveta Korolenko Dmytro Herez Maksym Zhuk Yuliia Malasai | align="left"| | 7:30.10 |} ==References== Category:2018 World Rowing Championships
title: 2018 World Rowing Championships – PR3 Mixed coxed four
